alert.note: Alert for Leake; Neshoba (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 5:04AM CDT until August 24 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Leake County in central Mississippi... Northern Neshoba County in east central Mississippi... * Until 715 AM CDT. * At 504 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches per hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Carthage, Edinburg, Pearl River, Renfroe, Dowdville, Singleton, Burnside, Stallo, Thomastown and Redwater. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
